title: National Alliance (Italy)
summary: National Alliance (Italian: Alleanza Nazionale, AN) was a conservative[5][6][7][8] political party in Italy. It was the successor of the post-fascist Italian Social Movement (MSI), which had moderated its policies over its last decades and finally distanced itself from its former ideology during a convention in Fiuggi by dissolving into the new party in 1995.[9][10]
